gameDetails.matchup: Denver Nuggets vs Golden State Warriors

recentPerformance.last3Games: 15 vs MIA, 19 vs MIN, 12 vs NOP in triple-doubles

keyFactors.title: Triple-Double Machine
keyFactors.description: Recorded triple-doubles in 5 of first 7 games to start season, including 4 consecutive. Only one game below 12.5 rebounds (7 vs SAC on Nov 4).

keyFactors.title: Recent Rebounding Explosion
keyFactors.description: 15 rebounds vs Miami (Nov 5), then 19 vs Minnesota in triple-doubles. Averaging 14.0 RPG per 36 minutes.

keyFactors.title: Previous Warriors Matchup
keyFactors.description: Grabbed 13 rebounds vs Golden State in season opener (Oct 23 overtime loss), suggesting this opponent wouldn't limit production.

keyFactors.title: Covers.com Featured Play
keyFactors.description: Highlighted as top NBA prop for Nov 7, noting 13.4 RPG average and dominance vs Warriors. DraftKings offered triple-double at -111 odds (52.61% implied).

riskFactors: Warriors missing Curry (illness 2nd consecutive game) could lead to blowout
Denver's home altitude (5,280 ft) creates fatigue for opponents - potential blowout
Elite efficiency could limit total possessions/rebounds available

quarterBreakdown.description: Denver jumped to 18-6 early lead. Jokić dominated with elite efficiency, grabbing boards on both ends.
Nuggets shot absurd 56.1% FG, 48.5% from three in first half. Extended to 66-49 halftime lead (17 points). Jokić on pace for triple-double.
Ballooned to 99-77 after three quarters (22-point lead). Game became non-competitive. Jokić reached 9 rebounds, 1 shy of expected pace.
Sat entire fourth quarter as bench absorbed minutes. Missing 8-10 minutes cost 3-4 rebounds at his season pace. Jonas Valančiūnas contributed in absence.

gameResults.whenMissed: Never reached 10+ rebounds. Missing entire Q4 (8-10 minutes) cost 3-4 boards at his 14.0 per-36 pace.
gameResults.gamePace: Denver's elite efficiency (56.1% FG) limited total possessions. Warriors went cold (42.1% FG overall). Reduced rebound opportunities.
gameResults.foulTrouble: No fouls - zero foul trouble. Simply pulled due to 25-point blowout.

whatWentWrong.title: 25-Point Blowout Killed Minutes
whatWentWrong.description: Sat entire fourth quarter - approximately 8-10 minutes missing. At 14.0 rebounds per 36 minutes pace, lost 3-4 critical boards. Missed line by 3.5 rebounds.

whatWentWrong.title: Too Efficient for Own Good
whatWentWrong.description: 80% shooting (12-15 FG) with 86% true shooting percentage so dominant that game became non-competitive by Q3. Efficiency paradox struck again.

whatWentWrong.title: Warriors Fatigued
whatWentWrong.description: Playing 5th consecutive road game, 3-in-4 nights schedule. Altitude (5,280 ft) compounded exhaustion. Without Curry, couldn't keep pace.

whatWentWrong.title: One Rebound from Triple-Double
whatWentWrong.description: Finished 26-9-9 - one board and one assist shy of sixth triple-double. Normal fourth quarter would have easily achieved both.

statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: -6 to -10 rebounds below 15-19 RPG recent games
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Per-minute pace: 11.6 rebounds per 36 - only slightly below season 14.0 pace. Not statistical anomaly.

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: No - pure game script. Rebounding rate (11.6 per 36) nearly on pace. If played typical 34-36 minutes in competitive game, almost certainly finishes with 12-14 rebounds.

closingLineValue.verdict: Neutral CLV. Every available metric supported OVER - 13.4 RPG, favorable matchup, home altitude, historical success vs Warriors. No amount of line shopping predicts 25-point blowout.

keyTakeaways: Blowouts are ultimate prop killer - even best analysis can't predict 25-point victories
Elite efficiency (80% FG, 86% TS%) creates blowouts that bench stars early
Missing 8-10 minutes = missing 3-4 rebounds at Jokić's pace. Math is cruel.
One rebound from triple-double (26-9-9) - normal game flow and he crushes OVER
Right process, wrong outcome - can't predict game script shifts this severe
verdict: Classic bad beat. Fundamentally sound based on 13.4 RPG average, 85.7% hit rate over 12.5, favorable matchup, home altitude. Lost purely to 25-point blowout cutting minutes. No analysis predicts this.
